result.execSummary:
The defendant Romell Roshode Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to the amended charge. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 138 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 138 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges, and DNA surcharges are to be paid by 9/8/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-6 month drivers license suspension
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Romell Roshode Lewis in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Romell Roshode Lewis in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State filed an amended information amending the charge to:
Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), oursuant to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassified Misdemeanor.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Romell Roshode Lewis not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is in Federal custody. Defense did not file a motion in this case. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 9/8/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Romell Roshode Lewis not in court, in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing.  Parties have been notified that effective August 3, 2014, this case is reassigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15, Room G-55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Motions must be filed byi 7-11-2014; responses due by 7-25-2014.  Motion hearing scheduled for 08-05-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed./ds

Defendant Romell Roshode Lewis in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Romell Roshode Lewis in custody.  William Levins for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Romell Roshode Lewis not in court, in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in Federal custody in Kenosha, not produced for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/9/14.

css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Romell Roshode Lewis in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Romell Roshode Lewis in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
